reviews.title: The Worst Service hidden theft
text: Flair is a scam. When you book online, you are not told about the other costs relating to your baggage. On arrival at Pearson Airport, I was told that I needed to pay for my carry on bag which came to 78 CAD and the lady who served me confirmed to me that the cost was for the round flight! While coming back from Halifax to Pearson airport I was again charged 78 CAD for my carry on bag! The cost of the ticket increased by 90% what a scam!

I advise fellow travellers to avoid Flair that company is a scam. Coupled with terrible customer service! The actions and treatment is horrible. I advise travellers to  take caution. Flair is such a terrible company! And no one cares! We are in an era of excellent service care travellers should avoid experience such terrible service bordering on theft.
I can predict and foresee that sooner than later Flair will be no more!

reviews.title: Kingston to Toronto Service
text: FlyGTA is fantastic! I would definitely recommend it - I have taken it twice so far. Ticket purchasing is fast and easy. They give you good directions on how to get to their terminal at Billy Bishop with the ticket confirmation. The pilots are super friendly, customer support is super responsive and boarding the plane is so fast! The flight itself was fast (about 35 minutes in the air), the seats were comfortable, and best of all, you get to your destination in a 1/3 of the time it takes the train! It's by far the best way to get to Kingston from Toronto!

reviews.title: Great sightseeing tour of Toronto!
text: I had an opportunity to go on a sightseeing flight around Toronto with FlyGTA and it was an enjoyable experience!

I had scheduled it less than a week in advance and everything went smoothly, from reservations, to checking in, COVID check, and the actual flight. It was all good! Our pilot, Ben, kept everything smooth.

Our aircraft, a Cessna Skywagon 207 is a six-seater, with a cabin that's narrower than the average car. Thankfully, it was just me, my cousin, and our pilot. It allowed us to spread out a bit and take pictures through the windows on either side of the aircraft.

Our air tour took us over Lake Ontario, going east to Scarborough Bluffs and then back towards the city, north of the downtown core. We went as far west as Little Italy and then circled downtown. One more trip around the islands and it was back to the airport. Smooth flight all around!
Although the weather was sunny, it was quite a bit hazy at times, depending on the angle. I did manage to get some decent images out of the 700+ shots though. I just posted a small sample here.

Going on this flight brought back memories of when I worked as a photographer, traveling to cities in the US and Canada, capturing images for postcards, calendars, and other souvenir items. Back then, digital cameras weren't around, so I'd have three cameras loaded with film, and a limited number of shots. Thank goodness for digital! Most of my flights in those days were in a helicopter with the doors removed for the clearest shots! I miss those days.
If you're looking for a different type of experience and a new way to discover our wonderful city, contact FlyGTA. They'll take good care of you!
PS - Our flight also included a bottle of champagne while on board!

reviews.title: Flight from Niagara to Toronto Island
text: I write this over a year after the fact because it was such an easy and enjoyable experience and I'm flying with them again this week as a result of that positive experience.  I flew St.Catharine's Niagara Regional Airport to the island in May 2019.  The flight was so easy compared to train and/or bus or even driving the boring highway only to sit in Toronto traffic once approaching from the west.   So, now I am trying the new Kingston to Toronto service later this week.   Should be fun if we don't get snowed in!   The only negative is the poor web site:  googling to get the real website we were lead to a similar one for a "Curly Airlines" but that soon became obvious as a test site of some sort.  I know FlyGTA are trying so giving the benefit of the doubt.  They've also been great to deal with over the phone.   Very friendly and well-organized.

reviews.title: Toronto Kingston flights - fast and convenient
text: We took return flights between Toronto Billy Bishop Airport and Kingston (Ontario) Norman Rogers Airport. It was fast and convenient - a great alternative to taking trains or buses.

At Billy Bishop, they don’t use the terminal (where Porter Airlines uses), so once you walk through the tunnel, before proceeding further to the terminal, take the elevator right after the tunnel on the side up to the ground (arrival) level. You go out of the building, and across the turn-around driveway further ahead you’ll see a small building with “STOLPORT” sign. You walk over there and speak to an agent inside who will help you check in and lead you to a small waiting lounge. Oh, since they are chartered flights. they don’t have those unpleasant security checks! We were the only passengers and we were there 40 minutes before the departure. Since we were all ready, they even departed early for us.

They don’t have tons of luggage space but they do take suitcases (they put them in the “nose” of the airplane or the back of the cabin). The small 8-seater plane is “well-loved” so if you expect a swanky private jet you might be a little disappointed, but we thought it was quaint. It is just so wonderful to be able to fly direct to Kingston from downtown Toronto - takes only 40-45 minutes one way. I definitely see the need for this as it is fast, convenient, relatively private, fun and easy to fly.

The building (both STOLPORT at Toronto Billy Bishop and Norman Rogers in Kingston) are fully accessible, but the airplane is a tiny 8-seater, so you will need to be able to climb up/down a small ladder to get on/off the plane. They won’t rush you so you can take time getting on/off if you need extra time.
(Information is based on our experiences as of October 2020)

I’d definitely recommend this as something different to do but also as a time saver as the drive takes 2 hours so great for people short on time.

reviews.title: Under 15 Minutes to the GTA
text: I’m a fan of aviation. I love to fly. I don’t know the intimate details and distinctions between DC-8 engine types, but exploring different aircraft types is always exciting. Sometimes this happens quite deliberately – I seek specific aircraft types out – and other times it happens, shall we say, by accident. This latter instance probably best describes how I happened upon FlyGTA and their Piper PA-31 aircraft. I was in the Niagara region on a bit of personal business and didn’t want to take a shuttle or bus all the way back into the GTA. It just takes up such a precious amount of time. And so, one morning, I decided to do a bit of random browsing online, thinking “there must be a faster way!” And voila! FlyGTA populated my search engine screen. The best part? The one-way flight was less than $100 AND took less than 15 minutes! In terms of value and convenience, this definitely trumps driving or taking a bus.

I made my way to the Niagara District airport. The flight was delayed due to low-lying cloud and a bit of stormy weather, but nevertheless arrived. After the lone passenger disembarked the aircraft at Niagara, we boarded the Piper PA-31 – there were a whopping two passengers on this flight, myself included. In essence, it was almost like flying a private plane into the GTA. What could be cooler than that? Oh! I know! How about adding a new aircraft type to my list? That’s what happened here as I’d never flown the PA-31 up to this point. Okay, that was just the icing on the proverbial cake.

The flight itself was good, albeit a bit bumpy. The crew was professional and helpful throughout. The only aspect I found a bit disappointing was that, due to the clouds, there was nothing to see while in the air. It would’ve been nice to see Lake Ontario from above; however, the lack of scenery wasn’t FlyGTA’s fault. That’s just how the weather was behaving.

Upon arrival at Billy Bishop, the crew again demonstrated their commitment to a high level of customer service and satisfaction: I was assisted from the terminal and pointed in the direction of Toronto proper. In many ways, the level of service reminded me of Pacific Coastal Airlines – very personable and down to earth, unlike our national flag carrier.

If you’re looking for an affordable and convenient option to commute between Toronto and the surrounding region, FlyGTA provides excellent value in this regard. They have a solid safety record, great staff and are intimately familiar with southern Ontario. Indeed, this is exactly what you’d want in a regional carrier.

reviews.title: Cost-effective solution to horrible Burlington - Oakville traffic
text: Rather than battle 2plus hours of horrible traffic from Niagara Peninsula through Burlington and Oakville and Mississauga to get to downtown Toronto, I flew from Niagara on the Lake airport to Billy Bishop on the island. The flight is 12 minutes across Lake Ontario. It took me 14 minutes to drive to the airport, I was there 15 minutes early, and then the 12 minute flight.

Do this math with me. I got up at 6:30 am in the Niagara Peninsula, and was walking up York St in Toronto at 8:10 after a very stress-free commute. Had I been driving, my best guess is I would have been just hitting Mississauga and stressed out.
Cost of the flight was about half of what it would have been had I stayed in a hotel downtown overnight. Parking was free at NOTL airport.
Fantastic views in every direction.

No downsides to this, except the plane is a Piper Apache. Two seats in the cockpit, 8 for passengers. Small seats. Extremely limited room for luggage or even a gym bag. I wouldn't want to be up there in this plane in any kind of turbulent weather.

reviews.title: Excellent trip from Muskoka to Billy Bishop
text: I was heading home solo on Sunday evening, and thought I would try a flight. In short: it was perfect. We were in the air for 36 minutes, and arrived in Toronto a few minutes ahead of schedule. I can only imagine what it would have been like on the bus on the 400!
Only thing I would say is that it’s a small plane (8 passenger seats). Personally I’m comfortable with that, but I know others might not enjoy the close quarters.
Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Great new option for Toronto to Wiarton

We'd do it again...as the trip on Friday afternoons would take at least 3 hours and the airplane did it in 45 mins flat.

reviews.title: Amazing flight from Wiarton to Toronto
text: I left Wiarton at 3pm with an amazing crew.  45 minutes later we landed beautifully with just awsome views at Toronto island airport.  A short (but fun) ferry ride to the shuttle that took me on the short ride to the UP train platform at Union station.  Another 30 minutes and I was checking in for my international flight to Europe at Toronto Pearson Airport- no driving, no parking, no traffic, no hassle.  Planes, trains, boats and automobiles but it all works and  Worth every penny for commuting from the Bruce Peninsula

reviews.title: From Niagara District (CYSN) To Billy Bishop Toronto City (CYTZ) - $99
text: Staff was very professional and overall the flight from NOTL to TORONTO was great! Worth every penny. Very fast responses and follow-ups. Billy Bishop Airport is very nice and clean. You can also bring luggage at an extra cost and the staff helps you with them too! Would fly with them again.

reviews.title: Simple yet perfect
text: Booked flights months ago, but due to weather they had to cancel. They provided excellent communication at that time and gave me credits to fly another time. Finally used it for flight to and from Toronto. Very basic with minimal staff or facilities, but was on time and perfectly suited my need for the short trip across the lake. Will be using again, and hope they continue to grow their business.

reviews.title: Amazing Experience and Customer Service
text: I wanted to surprise my boyfriend for his 30th with this treat and it was worth it! The whole experience, from the beautiful views from the plane, to the friendly and passionate staff. Customer support was awesome, Sarah answered all my questions ASAP and was very helpful over email and the phone. We were even running late but the staff on-site were super accommodating. One tip is I would recommend sitting on the pilot's side if you want a clearer view of the city, whereas the right side you see the lake more. Bonus is it was also easy to get to Billy Bishop Airport on Centre Island, and the ferry was a fun little trip. Definitely recommend!

reviews.title: THIS PLACE IS A SCAM! DO NOT BOOK WITH THEM!
text: Let me start by saying this company is the absolute worst! DO NOT TRUST, ITS A SCAM!

We had booked a private flight for Saturday Aug 08/2020 to celebrate what would have been our wedding day. We got a call on the evening of Aug 07 telling us that our flight was unfortunately cancelled due to a maintenance issue. We we're disappointed but these things happen and we get that. They told us that they would look into getting us our refund and call us right back. We never got a call back.

We called the next week inquiring about the refund, and they said the first gentlemen hadn't even issued it and that they would talk directly to their finance department and get back to us. They never got back to us! We called again a couple days later and got the same excuse, another gentleman saying he would look into it with the finance department and call us back. He never called back.

We called again the next day, spoke with another gentleman who said the refund was issued and that we should receive it in a couple days. The refund never came in. Its now been 11 days since they cancelled our flight with no refund in sight. I called back today to ask about it, and was told that the tech department was looking into it. Every time we call we get a different excuse. I ended up having to call my credit card company to have the refund issued because I was not getting anywhere with the people at FLYGTA.
DO NOT BOOK WITH THESE PEOPLE UNLESS YOU WANT TO GET SCAMMED!

reviews.title: St. Valentine's flight to TSO concert
text: Having recently retired and moved to NOTL, I wanted to try the flight to Billy Bishop. Never done this before.
So, we did on Feb 14, 2020 - and what a terrific experience it was.

FlyGTA staff were super-friendly and attentive, at both ends. After only 12 mins in the air, we touched down in Toronto. There is a complimentary Free Shuttle Bus running every 15 minutes to the Royal York Hotel, which makes anything Downtown very accessible.  Concert & Hotel were fabulous and we returned the next day. Derek was our co-Captain both ways.
This wins hands-down every time, compared to 1 or 2 hours on the QEW.
Thank you FlyGTA - we'll see you again !
John Buchanan
